subs.text: A story for old friends Robert Carr and Greg Stikeleather, who made a product called Framework, which I kind of hated because it was an outliner, easily as famous as ours was, even though they were nice people, and neighbors, and we spoke each others' language.

Many years have passed, and I'm still in touch with Stikeleather, because we're on Facebook, have lots of friends in common and we have the same birthday. We exchange emails every year, also with Roger McNamee who also shares our birthday.
Anyway, Robert and Greg would probably like that outliners are rebooting now, and one of the tags for the category is #toolsforthought. The other day I had an aha moment about this.
Their company was named Forethought. Which now I see was a clever pun, which I had not seen before.
A #toolforthought made by a company named Forethought. Ha! ;-)
BTW, we all won. So we can be friends.
PS: Ooops I remembered incorrectly. Their company was named Forefront, not Forethought. Never mind.
